sentence.Network_en: Curiosity is the taproot of an intellectual life , the most valuable of our simian traits.
sentence.Network_cn: 好奇是高智生命的根源，也是我们类人猿特征中最有价值的部分。

sentence.Network_en: The root system of the soybean consists of a taproot formed by the radicle.
sentence.Network_cn: 大豆的根系包括由胚根形成的主根.

sentence.Network_en: Censorship strikes at the taproot of our free society.
sentence.Network_cn: 检查制度动摇我们自由社会的根基.

list.abs: taproot stout , 1 cm thick or more , branched .直根坚固，1厘米厚或更多，分枝。
taproot thickened , elongate terete or clavate , fleshy , reddish reddish-yellow , or yellow .加厚的直根，拉长圆柱状或棍棒状，肉质，带红色，带红色黄，或黄的。
? 根部属于直根系(taproot system),即长而直的主根;直根上有大量侧根。 六、 被子植物  6.1 基本特性  ? 世界上占优的植物。 ? 明显的外在特性是有花和.
在有的物种里,初生根会变粗并成为整个植物的主根。此类根系(比如胡萝卜即为此类根系)被人称为主根系(taproot system)。块茎根茎(Tuberous roots)会生出一簇簇块茎.
taproots stout , branched near stem into a cluster of several long , woody , carrot-like roots with prominent annular scars when old .坚固的直根，接近茎的分枝形成一束数个长的，木质的，胡萝卜状的根，在老时具突出的环状的痕。

means.word_mean: 1. (botany) main root of a plant growing straight downward from the stem
2. something that provides an important central source for growth or development;

sentences.sentence: "genius and insanity spring from the same taproot"

auth_sentence.content: If the soil is dry, it can put all its energy into sending a single taproot in search of groundwater.
